Posts.Content: Apr 25, 2008 10:40PM MsSherry wrote: flyrzfan I could write the same post as you.  My left arm and hand is still numb and I have very limited use of it.  I am hopefull it comes back.  My left "breast" is also going through some issues with the skin.  My nipple and the skin on the areola is black and crusty.  I am loosing skin but it looks good underneath the skin.  I did not get the reconstruction due to bleeding bad and also ending up with a collapsed lung.  My breasts are very odd looking.  My right side the loose skin is pretty soft and moves easy.  My bad side it is hard still and I have to use q-tips to get inside the deep creases.  It was infected also and that have me on silver cream.  I go back to the PS on Monday.  Many (((((HUGS)))))!

Posts.Content: Apr 22, 2008 03:20PM MsSherry wrote: I just wanted to update everyone.  I was supposed to have a bilateral mastectomy on April 9th and have alloderm and implants done at the same time.  I had surgery but had some complications.  My left side muscle tore which caused excessive bleeding.  My left lung also was nicked and collapsed in the process of creating the pocket for the implant.  Needless to say I had my mastectomy but no reconstruction.  I may get it in June.  Currently I am having healing issues but hopefully everything will resolve.  I still am having quite a bit of pain and my left arm and hand is numb.  Good news is that it looks like this will be my only treatment :)  Hope everyone else does well!!
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 09:19PM MsSherry wrote: Good luck today Sally!  I hope everything goes well!
Posts.Title: Anyone having surgery in April?? ottawagirl wahine

Posts.Content: Apr 30, 2008 07:27AM MsSherry wrote: I understand your feelings 100%!  I had a mastectomy April 9th and they were unable to do my reconstruction so I woke up to being very flat.  It was not what I expected nor was I prepared for.  My best friend came over and called me over and over the first week.  I would cry and she would tell me over and over that my breasts do not make me.  She made me say it over and over until I finally started to believe it.  I am a petite lady (5'3" and 115 lbs @ was a 34 C) and wore juniors style clothing.  All of my tshirts are the form fitting type.  There was a joke this weekend when my daughter looked around at her family at the table (DH had been mowing and was shirtless) and exclaimed that daddy had the biggest boobies in the house now.  It felt good to be able to laugh.  2 weeks ago I would have run off to cry. Your body will be healed and you will be happy again I promise! (((((HUGS)))))

Posts.Content: MsSherry wrote: It will be 2 weeks since my implant surgery on Thur.  My right FOOB is red/pink.  I called my PS and she called in some Keflex (high dosage) and will see me for my follow up Wed.  She said if it is still red she may admit me for a PIC line and follow-up IV antibiotics at home.  WTH? Sherry Dx 4/25/2008, DCIS, 6cm+, Stage 0, Grade 3, 0/2 nodes, ER+/PR+, HER2+ Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Right Foob is red MsSherry MsSherry

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2008 04:01PM MsSherry wrote: I am home tonight but it looks like I will be going back in tomorrow for IV antibiotics.  If that does not work I loose the implant.She added Cipro as a last ditch effort.  I am very down.
Posts.Title: Right Foob is red MsSherry MsSherry

Posts.Content: Jun 14, 2008 07:53AM MsSherry wrote: The Dr put me in the hospital on Thur and they put in a PICC line.  I was given 3 doses of vancomyacin and by Friday morning the redness had improved.  An area of my incision opened and it is draining large amounts of fluid.  On Thursday she was pretty sure they were going to loose the implant and by the looks of my breast she was only going to give the IV therapy until Monday.  Yesterday she said she was optimistic I may keep my implant due to how it was looking.  I am home and getting home health IV therapy 2 times a day for 10 days since it is working.  I have to dress my breast 3 times a day (actually it has been more like every 2 hours due to the amount of drainage).  I go to the DR on Monday and they will decide then if they need to change anything.  The IDC DR did a swab of the wound but the results have not come back yet.  He is thinking it is staph.  They won't get that information until today or tomorrow.
Posts.Title: Right Foob is red MsSherry MsSherry

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2008 01:55PM MsSherry wrote: I am in a holding pattern.  It looks better than originally but worse than a few days ago.  I see the infection contril specialist Wed and he may want to add in a new medicine.  Hopefully that and not suggest implant removal.
Posts.Title: Right Foob is red MsSherry MsSherry

Posts.Content: Jun 10, 2008 06:52AM MsSherry wrote: Kathy I just took my 3rd dose and so far no change.  I was feeling really icky last night and did have a fever (101).  I loaded up on pain pills and added some advil.  I do not feel feverish this morning.  I told them last week I had been running a low grade off and on and she said post surgery that is somewhat normal in the first few days. Thanks everyone.  I hope this is just a small local infection and it clears.  What is the chance of it clearing?
Posts.Title: Right Foob is red MsSherry MsSherry

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2008 06:10PM MsSherry wrote: I am hoping we don't come to that.  I don't even want to go there mentally as getting to this point was a road full of issues.  I just want even let my brain go to removal.  This will work.  It has too.
Posts.Title: Right Foob is red MsSherry MsSherry

Posts.Content: Jul 14, 2008 06:58PM MsSherry wrote: Hey guys.  I have been doing ok.  I spent 5 days in the hospital and went home with 5 more days of home IV care.  So far no fevers or signs of infection.  Did end up with a roaring yeast infection and C.diff colitis with ulcers.  So I am on meds for that.  I saw my gyn onc and they are scheduling an ooph in August. My DCIS was highly ER/PR+ and my right ovary currently is enlarged.  They want to get them out sooner rather than later.  I am pushing the swap out of implants until November.  I just want my foobs to heal more.  Thanks everyone for the well wishes.  It has been a rotten 3 months that is for sure.
Posts.Title: Right Foob is red MsSherry MsSherry

Posts.Content: Jun 11, 2008 08:33AM MsSherry wrote: Today it looks worse.  The pain down my arm is now also up into my neck.  I have been eating yogurt along with the antibiotics.  I go in today at 1.  I hope that they can find a way to bypass the IV antibiotics.
Posts.Title: Right Foob is red MsSherry MsSherry

Posts.Content: Jun 17, 2008 03:52PM MsSherry wrote: New update: Just noticed a 1 in by 1 in blister on the underside of my breast.  I called my PS and she is going to see me tomorrow.  It MAY be just an area that was rubbed a bit and caused a blister or it may be my implant trying to come out.  She said if it pops tonight and the skin looks pink uner than it is probably just a blister.  I did not ask what it will look like if it is my implant....  Tomorrow may be the defining day.  I am almost sick to my stomach thinking that I am going to loose this implant and will not be able to replace it for 6 months :(

Posts.Content: May 18, 2008 05:20AM MsSherry wrote: They nicked my lung during my surgery and they were able to patch it while I was open avoiding the chest tube BUT for about 2 weeks I had some pain on that side when I inhaled.  They said it was healing and normal BUT if it got bad I needed to be seen to make sure the lung was still fully inflated and there were no clots.  You do not want a PE (BTDT).
